As an Egyptian Muslim - and a lawyer and spokesman in the Islamic thought and political affairs, and Islamic and public, his studies of constitutional law and legalities are extensive. He's thought to represent the [[Salafist]] movement within Egypt. As studies and research specialist, his studies are abundant in three sciences : education, administration, and the economy,all of which he compiled for 25 years. After graduating from the Law Faculty of [[Cairo University]] in 1982, he was the third of the merited graduates.
In a video-clip posted on 4 August 2011, he praises [[Osama bin Laden]] as a martyr, and for "speaking the word of truth to power," for "going to the front lines to work in the path of Allah." Ismail says "I ask Almighty Allah that the Muslims may soon be able to avenge him."[www.youtube.com/watch?v=7djHoCTWvWk]
Ismail was a long-standing member of the Muslim Brotherhood. He left it when he ran for President. Ismail affirmed that although he is proud of being affiliated to the [[Muslim Brotherhood]] (MB), he is not a member and has some minor differences.<ref name="mb affiliation"/> Ismail had a well-established role as the defendant of the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], facing charges of "Endangering National Security" during the [[Hosni Mubarak]] reign.
His father was the well known Salah Abu Ismail, one of the most prominent Al-Azhar scholars and the only independent member of the [[Majlis]] during the Sadat reign.
Throughout his presidential campaign, Dr.Hazem stressed the need for enhancing the cinema and tourism industries in Egypt through a variety of ways & methods, a move not expected by many secular intellectuals in the political arena.{{reference needed|date=November 2011}}
However, in November, 2011 Hazem gave two television interviews in which he called for "Islamic dress" for women, including the [[burqa]], saying that any woman caught wearing a bikini should be arrested.<ref>[http://www.jihadwatch.org/2011/11/egypt-islamic-supremacist-presidential-candidate-vows-to-arrest-bikini-wearing-women-if-elected.html Jihad Watch 11/15/2011]</ref>
